entry.body: Command. This will take an identifier (*not* the current one) or a parent transaction and return all tokens that are associated with it.
Property: List of strings. The list of audiences in the request for this exchange, if any.
Property: Integer (0) The time at which this token expires in milliseconds.
Property: Integer (0) The time this token was issued in milliseconds.
Property: String (--) The issuer (if custom and different from the standard issuer) for this token.
Property: Integer (0) The lifetime in milliseconds for this token.
Property: Identifier (**) The unique identifier of the transaction associated with this exchange record.
Property: List of URIs The list of resources that were in the request for this exchange.
Property: JSON (--) The list of scopes in the request for this exchange, if any.
Property: Identifier (**) The unique identifier for this token. It is the id (asserted as jti in the tiken itself) for this token.
Property: String (--) The type of the token as per the specification, e.g. urn:ietf:params:oauth:token-type:refresh_token
Property: Boolean (true) If the token is valid.
This store contains all of the exchange records. Exchange records are created from the refresh and exchange endpoint and are associated with a transaction.
